metadata.title: CVE-2024-42320 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:s390/dasd: fix error checks in dasd_copy_pair_store()dasd_add_busid() can return an error via ERR_PTR() if an allocationfails. However, two callsites in dasd_copy_pair_store() do not checkthe result, potentially resulting in a NULL pointer dereference. Fixthis by checking the result with IS_ERR() and returning the error upthe stack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42320` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
